title.rendered: England vs India, Women’s T20 World Cup 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

England: Sophia Dunkley, Danielle Wyatt, Alice Capsey, Nat Sciver Brunt, Heather Knight (c), Amy Jones (wk), Katherine Sciver Brunt, Sophie Ecclestone, Charlotte Dean, Sarah Glenn, Lauren Bell

India: Smriti Mandhana, Shafali Verma, Jemimah Rodrigues, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Richa Ghosh (wk), Deepti Sharma, Pooja Vastrakar, Devika Vaidya, Radha Yadav, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, Renuka Thakur Singh

Pitch Report

Venue: St George’s Park, Port Elizabeth

(Based on the last two games)

1st innings average score: 109

2nd innings average score: 127

Wickets per innings: 4

Type: Good for pace

Wins

Batting 1st: –

Batting 2nd: 100%

Fantasy Tips of The Day 

Smriti Mandhana loves facing England. She has scored 608 runs at 40.5 against England. However, in 2023, she has only one score above 10 runs in six outings.

Harmanpreet Kaur has scored 427 runs against England. Her recent form has been impressive: she has generated 30-run bonus in four of the last seven T20Is.

Deepti Sharma has three three-wicket hauls in the last six T20Is. She loves bowling in South Africa where she has 15 wickets in 8 matches.

Shafali Verma averages 31 in South Africa but only 15 against England.

Katherine Sciver Brunt has troubled the Indian batters a lot. She has picked up 23 wickets in 18 matches.

Sophie Ecclestone has a mixed bag of numbers against India. In the last seven matches, she has gone wicketless in four and picked up three-wicket hauls in two.

25% of her sixes and one of the two centuries that Dannielle Wyatt has scored have come against India. Overall, she has collected 543 runs.

Nat Sciver-Brunt presents all-round potential. She averages 27 against India with the bat, has taken 7 wickets, and has pouched 9 catches

Sophia Dunkley has six 30-plus scores in the last eight matches and averages 45 over that period.

Charlotte Dean has already scalped 13 wickets at a stunning strike rate of 9.6 in only 7 T20Is.
